definition: schizonepeta, herb used in Chinese medicine
chaste tree or berry (Vitex agnus-castus)/alternative name for the Zhou Dynasty state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]

sentences.english: Objective To compare the effects of powders with different diameters of schizonepeta on anti-pyretic and analgesic effects.
sentences.chinese: 目的荆芥不同粒径粉体的解热镇痛作用的比较研究。

sentences.english: Disclosed are methods for treating catmint oil.
sentences.chinese: 本发明公开了处理荆芥油的方法。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE Study on the best processing degree of carbonized catnip.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨荆芥炭的最佳炮制程度。

sentences.english: Objective The essential oils from Nepeta cataria L. were extracted by steam distillation. Methods The chemical constituents were analyzed by GC-MS.
sentences.chinese: 目的采用水蒸气蒸馏法从荆芥中提取挥发油。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To observe the effect of Herba Schizonepetae Tenuifoliae lipids on acute inflammation of mice.
sentences.chinese: 目的观察荆芥酯类成分对急性炎症的影响。

definition: black atractylodes rhizome (dried rhizome of any of several atractylodes species) (TCM)
Chinese thorowax (Bupleurum chinense)/root of Chinese thorowax (used in TCM)
dried fruit of immature citron or trifoliate orange (used in TCM)
root bark of the peony tree (used in TCM)
